str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A priest, one who offers sacrifice to a god (in Jewish and pagan religions; of Christians only met.). From hieros; a priest.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From pros and phero; to bear towards, i.e. Lead to, tender, treat.
A gift, present. A present; specially, a sacrifice.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
